trial_identification.scientifictitle: The influence of acupuncture on the induction of labour for women with a post date pregnancy: a randomised controlled trial.

conditions.healthcondition: Women with a post date pregnancy

interventions.interventions: Group 1 (Treatment with acupuncture): women will receive a series of acupuncture treatment over a 1 hour period prior to their planned induction. Classical acupuncture points Hegu LI4, Sanyinjiao SP6, Shangliao UB31 and Ciliao UB2, Zusanli ST36, Taichong LR3 or alternative combinations will be used. Any underlying pathology such as deficiency of Blood or Qi, or stagnation of Qi and Blood will be examined, and treated, if appropriate.
interventions.comparator: Group 2 sham acupuncture points (body points which are not acupuncture points and away from classical acupuncture points) will be selected on the sacral area, hand, foot, a point below the knee and lower leg.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Time of acupuncture treatment to the delivery of the baby
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The primary outcome measures specified a priori, related to the outcome of induction and were assessed by: a reduction in the need for prostaglandins, oxytocin and artifical rupture of membranes for induction of labour, measured following the birth of the baby.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in Bishops score from trial entry
primaryOutcome.timepoint:
The primary outcome measures specified a priori, related to the outcome of induction and were assessed by: a reduction in the need for prostaglandins, oxytocin and artifical rupture of membranes for induction of labour, measured following the birth of the baby.
Measured following vaginal examination on admission to hospital.

The primary outcome measures specified a priori, related to the outcome of induction and were assessed by: a reduction in the need for prostaglandins, oxytocin and artifical rupture of membranes for induction of labour, measured following the birth of the baby.
Measured after birth of the baby and neonatal outcomes included incidence of fetal distress.

Measured after birth of the baby and neonatal outcomes included incidence of fetal distress.

Measured after birth of the baby and neonatal outcomes included incidence of fetal distress.

The primary outcome measures specified a priori, related to the outcome of induction and were assessed by: a reduction in the need for prostaglandins, oxytocin and artifical rupture of membranes for induction of labour, measured following the birth of the baby.
Measured after the birth of the baby.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Rooming in of infant with mother
primaryOutcome.timepoint:
The primary outcome measures specified a priori, related to the outcome of induction and were assessed by: a reduction in the need for prostaglandins, oxytocin and artifical rupture of membranes for induction of labour, measured following the birth of the baby.
Measured after admission of the mother to postnatal ward.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Secondary outcomes were measured following delivery and following discharge of the mother and baby.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fetal heart rate abnormalities in labour
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured following the birth of the baby.
Secondary outcomes were measured following delivery and following discharge of the mother and baby.
Secondary outcomes were measured following delivery and following discharge of the mother and baby.
Measured on discharge of the baby.
Measured after delivery of the baby.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Women > or = 41 weeks booked for delivery at Women's and Children's Hospital; singleton pregnancy; cephalic presentation; informed written consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Active labour (cervix fully effaced > or = 3cm dilated) and regular uterine contractions; contra-indications to induction of labour or vaginal delivery; women with spontaneous premautre rupture of membranes.

trial_design.sequence: An independent researcher developed the computer generated randomization schedule with variable block size and stratification by parity (nulliparous and multiparous)
trial_design.designfeatures: Subjects are blind in this study. Data was collected by researchers not involved with the administration of the trial intervention and the analysis was carried out by an independent statistician blind to the womans study group.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Dept Obstetrics and Gynaecogy North Terrace Adelaide SA 5005

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medial Research Council

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of the research was to determine if acupuncture adminisitered to women with a post term pregnancy would reduce the need for induction.
